summary:
A pharmaceutical professional driving organizational strategies within the HIV ecosystem. 
Highly adept in performing within high-pressure and deadline-driven environments, supported by excellent problem-solving, project management, and multitasking skills. Strong process optimization skills within global health supply chain dynamics.
Methodical approach in the execution of operational and commercial strategies in access markets to ensure continued achievements of organizational HIV targets. Clear understanding of tender and contracting strategies within dynamic and complex markets.

education.field_of_study: Logistics, Materials, and Supply Chain Management

profile_positions.description:
•	Maintains knowledge of new developments in the healthcare system, anticipating potential opportunities and risks on the business and adapt strategy accordingly to help in shaping the healthcare environment 

•	Serves as a key contact for input and interpretation of issues that impact product demand and supply, sales, and costing. Has primary responsibility for working with different functions in a teamwork spirit such as Supply Chain, Operations and Planning to resolve these issues as required 

•	Effectively manage and execute all marketing and sales related franchise activities as per franchise Plan, such as development and implementation of commercial franchise strategy and tactical franchise activities execution and deliver sales performance to maximize or exceed franchise sales and margin within expense budgets 

•	Overseeing tender and contract business development in Africa 

•	Hold accountability for allocated Franchise P&L in terms of franchise sales and financial planning (Financial Plan, Focus/Update, Long Range Plan) 

•	Liaise with relevant Area and Global functions in order to integrate global and area strategy/tactics into the local brand planning strategy and execution and to facilitate the development and alignment of global and area brand vision and strategic objectives
profile_positions.title: Business Unit Manager - HIV

profile_positions.description:
•	Foster deep understandings of complexities and opportunities associated with decision-making matrix within each key account.

•	Develop an in-depth understanding of Global policies, Country Operational Plan strategies, guidelines implementation and overall program deliverables

•	Understand funder initiatives driving access to HIV care, treatment, and prevention. Determine business unit strategy impact based on healthcare program's

•	Maintain responsibility of sales, contracts, negotiations and reporting for all key accounts

•	Compile tender database incorporating competitor activity and price/volume mix data

•	Independently work with internal and external stakeholders to collect critical market data and provide detailed analysis and recommendations on tender opportunities and risks

•	Research and implement new improvement processes and methodologies contributing to improved customer KPI scoring. Provide cross functional teams with insight and direction to optimize service delivery in alignment with individual account needs

•	Contribute towards Brand P&L in terms of brand sales and financial planning (Financial Plan, Update and Long-Range Plan)

•	As core Brand Team Member, provide key account insights contributing towards Brand Strategy, outlying market opportunities and risks
profile_positions.title: Key Account Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	Developed strategic relationships with key accounts to determine complexities and opportunities associated with decision making

•	Collaborated with internal stakeholders to develop new surveys and questionnaires to determine customer KPI requirements

•	Compiled monthly customer feedback and recommended service delivery improvements to management

•	Monitored metrics and developed actionable plans to improve efficiency and performance. Measured account KPI success with clear metrics to attain 80/100 (%) goal within four (4) months

•	Resolved conflicts by negotiating with internal and/or external stakeholders in order to reach win-win solutions to disagreements

•	Maintained customer, tenders and contracts databases to ensure compliance and governance protocols are adhered too

•	Monitored individual account current demand trends, market conditions and competitor actions to adjust strategies and achieve sales targets

•	Lead demand meetings with business unit functions to assess Month-End and Plan targets

•	Contributed towards Sales and Operations Planning meeting with input into market drivers and sales plans
profile_positions.title: Customer Relationship Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
•	Responsible for end-to-end order fulfillment with 3PL (DSV) to National Department of Health South Africa and Private Sector facilities

•	Managed inventory (≈ 3 million units) and proposed business improvement strategies to prevent delivery delays and achieve vendor-on-time-delivery targets

•	Reviewed and improved internal processes to increase efficiencies without compromising customer service levels

•	Reviewed historical sales trends, analyzed demand drivers, and prepared forecast data to develop forecast models and evaluate forecast results

•	Increased visibility and accountability into key forecast accuracy metrics by identifying sources of error and developing mitigation plans (improved forecast accuracy by 17%)

•	Cross-functionally collaborated with commercial teams to support commercial in-field strategies

•	Maintained accurate customer data and developed monthly sales tracking dashboards to support business objectives

•	Supported management with monthly inventory and logistics reports in preparation for Sales & Operations Planning meeting. Developed reporting tools and provided insight into demand forecasts
profile_positions.title: Logistics Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
•	Evaluated 3PL (DHL and Dawn Wing) performances, reviewed and monitored inbound deliveries and outbound shipments

•	Conducted thorough inventory inspections and initiated  returns management processes 

•	Maintained adequate levels of inventory based on sales forecasts and demand to fulfill daily orders timeously

•	Accountable for inter-warehouse inventory transfers and maintained optimal consignment inventory levels at Netcare & Life Healthcare hospital groups

•	Forecast and replenish inventory to all internal distribution centers bi-weekly. Ensure optimal inventory levels are maintained and mitigated stock-outs.

•	Manage and lead planned stock takes. Address and solve all inventory variances and generate operational plans for future mitigation 

•	Maintain and report on master data inventory filing. Ensure accuracy and relevance of legacy inventory data

•	Accountable for monthly inventory EXCO reporting (inventory on hand, expiration risk, performance and consignment holding)
profile_positions.title: Senior Inventory Controller

profile_positions.description:
•	Enhancing customer service initiatives during pre and post-sales periods

•	Advancing sales strategy by developing Level B customers into Level A Key Accounts (4% sales across three customers totaling ZAR 821,000 per year)

•	Determine customers' strategy and organizational responses to changing environments.

•	Key Accounts Management Reporting
	*     Monthly reporting and analysis
	*     Sales Month closure vs Yearly Plan
profile_positions.title: Customer Service Representative
